question: Looking at this choropleth map, which statement below is the most accurate?

options.A: State A and State B have very similar values.
options.B: The value gap between State A and State B might exceed that between State J and State B.
options.C: All three States (A,B,J) have very diverse values.
options.D: The value differences are impossible to determine from this visualization.

explanation: State A (30) and State B (45) have a 15-point difference, while State B (45) and State J (55) have a 10-point difference. However, the categorical color encoding groups A and B into the same color bin (25-50 range), making their difference appear similar, while B and J appear more different due to different color bins.
